intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides f. alpinum, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
